intro: Lavatera rotundata, commonly known as the woolly sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is an annual or biennial herb that grows up to 1.5 meters tall, with a sprawling or upright habit depending on the variety. Its fibrous stems and leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber. Lavatera rotundata is also valued in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
